title: Brill Tramway Trail Walking Route

images.title: Buckinghamshire Railway Centre by Mike Smith, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Buckinghamshire Railway Centre

images.title: Andy Gryce / Railway trackbed near Westcott 1
images.caption: Railway trackbed near Westcott. This path marks the trackbed of the Wotton Tramway opened in 1870 that ran from Quainton Road station to the village of Brill, a distance of six and a quarter miles. The trackbed lies alongside the C road to the left from the A41 (1/2km behind the camera) to Quainton Road station, 1km further up the road.

images.title: Bill Tyne from Oxford, England, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Waddesdon Manor

images.title: Hywel Williams, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tramway Business Park, Brill, Buckinghamshire. The business park gets its name from the Brill Tramway, which ran from Quainton Road and terminated in a station near where the business park stands today. It is astonishing to think that this was the terminus of a branch of the Metropolitan Line, run by the London Underground until 1936.

images.title: Andy Gryce / Field and footpath near Quainton
images.caption: Field and footpath near Quainton

images.title: Hywel Williams / A Farm Road
images.caption: A Farm Road. This farm road is the original location for Wotton Station on the Brill Tramway, which ran from Quainton Road to Westcott.

description: This short circular walk follows the bed of the Brill tramway, through Quainton, Westcott and Waddesdon. You start at Quainton and follow the path to the Buckingham Railway Centre where you will find a working steam museum set in a 25 acre site. The walk then continues through Westcott to the exquisite Waddesdon Manor. Built in the style of a French chateau between 1874 and 1889 for Baron Ferdinand de Rothschild the house is also surrounded by formal gardens and an English landscape park. The final stretch takes you through the pretty village of Waddesdon to the finish point at Quainton.
